website_summaries.verdict: If you prefer to split kindling the traditional way, consider this workhorse splitting axe from Fiskars.
pros: Intended for one-handed use.Designed to give more one-strike splits
Included sheath protects blade and user
Forged steel blade with coating that prevents sticking
Comes in a variety of sizes
cons: Axe head can become brittle in cold weather

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use ergonomic movement can slice through large wood w ease even for an old
customer_reviews.text: The best . The minute I picked it up I was Like wow. The first throw of axe I chopped a 12” piece of oak. That says it all I’m a small woman in WV. I’d never get another axe . Was walking down road some Mexican tree experts cutting trees - they were splitting wood w a fisker ; that says it all from common person like me to professionals this is the best axe. Period
customer_reviews.author: wv jeep

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for camping.  Just needed a little help.
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT quality. Came very sharp right out of the box. I used a small knife sharpening stone and put a razor edge on it in about 2 minutes. Only complaint is WHY didn't Fiskars put a belt loop on the sheath?!? I got the idea to make belt loops out of paracord off youtube and it's a GREAT added feature! At 2 1/2 lbs, keep your belt tight though! OR use the paracord loops to attach it to the outside of your pack (Reflective paracord makes the sheath MUCH easier to find in the dark too) Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: SrirachaHOT

customer_reviews.title: Made by fiskars..
customer_reviews.text: Easy for carrying into woods or light camping fiskars last ..I've had my main axe for 20+ years and I I've missed the tree once or 20 times (in a hurry) hit below axe hesd on handle with no breaks ,cracks or bad vibrations on hand or hands..will always use fiskars tools if available
customer_reviews.author: Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Made in Finland and quality shows
customer_reviews.text: used it couple of times for chopping logs and works very well. no sign of breaking. Very well-balanced, grippy handles, splits logs easily due to sharpness. while others struggled with their hatchets, i already had a nice campfire going. Dont even need to worry about damaging it as its very tough due to its design.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: I might just have to buy another as well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just to break up some logs and make kindling, and this axe makes the job so darned easy, and makes the user look like a pro. Absolutely no effort is required to split logs with this using one hand. I'm astounded at how well this did at literally splitting logs on one pass, especially if you go with the grain (you're supposed to). I might have to buy another, just in case they outsource manufacturing or change the design. The end of the handle also allows you to swing easily as it sticks into your palm comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome budget axe
customer_reviews.text: It’s not the cream of the corp, but this axe is very impressive indeed. If you are looking for a budget axe and something built to last, this is it. I mean this axe slices through wood like butter. It’s almost as impressive as some of my other bushcraft axes I own. Another thing I thought was cool is that the handle is hollow. If you’re very creative, you can stuff some survival stuff instead the handle. Overall, great axe and I’m glad it’s in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Some folks dream about axes... or just great tools. Open your eyes. This is for real. Ye Ha
customer_reviews.text: No matter how you cut it... this axe is by far the best one I've ever used... period. I'm splitting 18" - 24" long cut off hedge posts that are 75 years old. The wood is some of the densest on the planet and it's actually fun to split. ... AND after half an hours "work" I end up with the best firewood this side of Mount Koochupichikama-yama. It's that good. Toss your three old Boy Scout/ Camp Fire Girls axes in the wood stove and use the heads for door stops. You're done. You found the axe of your dreams... and so did I.
customer_reviews.author: Tedd Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Splitting Tool, Beyond The Best!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had Sooo Many Axe's, Wedges & Mauls to split wood & really wanted something portable like a hatchet, that could do the job of an Axe. This Thing is beyond amazing & can split big rounds. When you own one of these you cant believe you ever lived without it!
customer_reviews.author: Deep Space

customer_reviews.title: Still looks like new and splits like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This is the hatchet one wants during the zombie apocalypse. I am not sure if over engineered can be done on a hatchet but this is about as close as one can get. I use it to split oak and sometimes I have to hit it with a 5lb maul to drive it through. Still looks like new and splits like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: CameronC

customer_reviews.title: Lizzy Borden would have been in Heaven with this beauty
customer_reviews.text: This is light strong and is great on brush up to splitting firewood and doing inside demolition work, this replace 60 years of hatchets. Also a great price vs box stores. I am going to get another they are so handy!
customer_reviews.author: David S. Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how much I love this hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Surprised at how much I love this hatchet. Others had issues with the blade not being sharp but that was not an issue I had. It cuts through dry, soft wood like butter and the harder woods don't offer too much more resistance. I'm also surprised at how much I like the handle. It is hollow, which makes it lighter but is stronger than you feel it has any right to be. Add to all this the reports that Fiskars will replace any items you have issues with, I would say it is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: M. FitzGerald

customer_reviews.title: Buy one if you don't have one and need one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to split firewood for kindling for my home woodstove. Perfect size and weight to split big pieces but light enough to handle safely. Soft steel compared to other axes but easy to sharpen. Love super aggressive edge angle. Coating works well but like all blade coatings wears off quickly enough to be of no real use. Saves my nice axes from daily wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Well made axe
customer_reviews.text: Well made - although I'd probably buy bigger. And I don't like that the handle is so light as it makes the axe harder to balance for an accurate swing (all the weight is in the head)
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Hesitate- Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Christmas gift. He LOVES it and I actually wished I had purchased more for other men in the family. Very good price and quality. Lightweight and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Kim777

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what I was missing out on
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize there was so much variety in hatchets until I dug a little deeper and found out about these guys. It's a night and day difference between this splitting axe and a "normal" hatchet
customer_reviews.author: Isaac DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: I was really disappointed with the splitting axe
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with the splitting axe. Looking at it, I would assume that the wood would fly apart when sp[itting, but it doesn't. The edge geometry, or maybe the weight of the head is just a little off. If you choke up on the handle, it is difficult to hit the wood square but hits just right when gripping the end of the handle. I use one of the older splitting hatchets without the added wedge, but it doesn't seem to be any better. I hopr that Fiskars takes this criticism as constructive and keeps working on the design.
customer_reviews.author: Don Walker

customer_reviews.title: Second Fiskars axe.
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Fiskars - have both the X27 and X11. Both of mine were made in Finland. Chops pine and fur like hot knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: D'bo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing One Hand Splitter.
customer_reviews.text: I got a chance to really put it through its paces today and all I can say is that I’m really impressed. Its long enough to use two hands but its perfect as a one handed tool, I just let the X11 do all the work. It was actually sort of fun using this, when I did my part I got a one hit split and using only hand (too cool). I was kinda sad when I split all the wood I had. The sheath is well made, I just wish it had a belt clip.
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: About as sharp as a golf ball
customer_reviews.text: Had to sharpen it as it came with a rolled edge. Used it to split some wood I got from the store and the edge chipped like crazy and broke apart. The blade was definitely not tempered or treated.
customer_reviews.author: Anubis Reviews

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT! This is just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! This is just what I was looking for. Great little splitting axe. It replaced one that I have had for over 30 years. I would recommend this axe to anyone looking for a very sharp light weight easy to use axe. I would buy it again! My son also has the 36" Fiskars axe and says it is the best axe he has ever used. I agree!! However, I just needed something to spit wood with. He uses his for large pieces of wood he wants to split. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: Really are the best
customer_reviews.text: Really is an amazing design. Mechanical advantages created by innovation in hatchet design put this thing way above normal axes or hatchets. Very light , excellent chopping capacity. NEW NOTE: DO NOT BUY THRU AMAZON, they will allow some scam retailers to bait and switch you and the " a-z guarantee" is no guarantee it's just a marketing scheme so you feel safe but once's your scammed they just keep the money. They do not care about anything but your money try a small business who cares. I was a long time purchaser thru amazon but I got ripped off. I should have never fell for the big business scam.
customer_reviews.author: So cal survival 2012 +

customer_reviews.title: Splits Like a Breeze!!
customer_reviews.text: Living in the Pac NW, I have had some experience cutting wood........LOTS of experience. This splitting axe is expertly designed, and splits wood incredibly easy. I now use it instead of my big axe to cut kindling which has saved time and my back. I would HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone looking for a top-notch way to split wood. The design simply SCREAMS quality, and seems very, very well engineered. I will definitely think Fiskars in the future for any more axes.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Eltoukhy

customer_reviews.title: But I honestly can't find anything bad to say about this one
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this axe 5 stars because I can't find anything wrong with it. I haven't used every axe out there, so I can't do direct comparisons. But I honestly can't find anything bad to say about this one. It's light, swings well, splits wood (it's job) and comes with a handy little sheath/hanger to put it up with. It must be pretty good, because I see now that Ozark Trail is copying it.
customer_reviews.author: JR in NC

customer_reviews.title: Feels good for a camping splitter
customer_reviews.text: We went camping this last weekend and found this axe was perfect for splitting up seasoned camp wood. The weight feels just right for car camping, and yet the handle is longer than your typical camp axe. It's not going to work well for chopping down trees, for that you need a different blade. But this one is GREAT for splitting logs that are already cut, but not the right size or shape for your fire. The only thing I don't like so much is the case is really made for hanging on the wall, not for throwing in a box to go camping. But this is such a minor issue it doesn't detract from the product.
customer_reviews.author: Madelyn

customer_reviews.title: Best kindling hatchet I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best "hatchet" that I've ever had the pleasure to use. It (and it's big brother the X36) have made wood cutting & splitting almost a joy... The balance on this splitting ax it great, enough weight in the head to get through the log, while the handle is short enough to make it ideal for taking an already split piece of wood down to kindling. Highly recommended and I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Kettner

customer_reviews.title: Greatest hand axe ever!
customer_reviews.text: You could not find a better axe at any price. Great for hand splitting and trimming. Purchased a second one.
customer_reviews.author: James Ball

customer_reviews.title: 2nd 17 Splitting Axe for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 2nd 17 in splitting axe not to replace the first, but to keep in my camper as I was tired of trying to find it, or forgetting to bring it along on camping trips. The 1st axe I bought is still going strong after roughly 10 years. I can't say enough about this axe. For me it is the perfect camp axe, it can split larger logs, and handles the small stuff with ease. It holds an edge very well, and using the Fiskars sharpener, is very easy to bring it back to factory fresh sharpness. Get one or two, they are a GREAT buy.
customer_reviews.author: kzoo1

customer_reviews.title: Quality Axe!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this axe for a solid 2 years now (as of 05/08/14) and it is still as sharp as the first day I bought it. I mainly use this axe for camping in the summers and chopping firewood for those late night backyard parties and winter firewood. This past winter I used it to chop up my Christmas tree into pieces that fit in a large cardboard box (I missed tree pickup in my neighborhood by a month so I needed it to fit in my car to bring to the town recycling center for composite).
customer_reviews.author: dirkkid360

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Could Award this Product More Stars...
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of BBQ smoking in a small cooker. This axe makes quick work of my log splits, and I can cut them precisely to the size I want bc the size and balance of this thing is truly remarkable. I'm convinced this axe has saved me an eventual trip to the ER had I continued to use the maul this thing replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Great splitting Axe - just a great usable size
customer_reviews.text: Completely love this 17" splitting axe. I wanted something for me to break down logs or plants of wood into manageable kindling - and this does the job perfectly. Good weight head and a light handle which feels secure in your hand as has a bit at the end to ensure wont fly out of your grasp. A couple of other makes have similar axes and may be a same parent company - but I trust Fiskars to have quality blades on all their tools and so would recommend this as a reliable tool.
customer_reviews.author: Pippen148

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Love this small axe. We keep it in our RV and use it for everything you could imagine needing it for. Awesome footprint and weight. Powerful and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Branigan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Splitting Axe
customer_reviews.text: This axe is extremely handy, easy to use, safe and light. It is very portable but does the trick on logs much larger than expected. Worth every penny, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars is best!
customer_reviews.text: Love the oversized hatchet. Wood goes flying! easy to split with this superior tool, fiskars knows the science of splitting
customer_reviews.author: Paul Van Velzer

customer_reviews.title: Great axe!!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect splitting axe. I even used this to help butcher a deer this year. Great axe!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Mom

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I went with this
customer_reviews.text: I had this on my wish list for ever. I kept going back and forth between buying this and a cheap hatchet. I'm glad I went with this. Other reviewers have gone on about how nice this is for splitting firewood and let me tell you they are right. I'd buy it again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: E. Avalos

customer_reviews.title: 3 Fiskars Axe and all have been flawless
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Fiskars Axe. I don't know the length of each so I'll call them short, medium and long. They have all been flawless. I like this one because it has a heavier axe head and is a little wider for one split swings and this is light enough to use one hand. If you need a camp axe, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars Splitting Axe
customer_reviews.text: The hand maul was purchased for splitting small wood to be used in a backyard fire pit. It is very well made as one would expect from Fiskars and is honed to a sharp edge. It is not as wedge like as I have experienced with full sized mauls but it splits wood very nicely and is well balanced. The handle is comfortable and easy to hold without fear of slipping. I am very satisfied with this purchase from Amazon and recommend it for anyone who has need of a wood splitter for smaller sized wood.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This axe is an awesome addition to my camping gear. It’s bigger then a hatchet but not so large it hogs valuable space. The weight is perfect for splitting logs and making kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Fathers Day and he really was impressed by it. Also gave him the Fiskars Sharpner to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Drake

customer_reviews.title: great ax
customer_reviews.text: really fine ax, handle is indestructible. blade chipped immediately even though i was being careful
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp! this is a wood splitting machine.I use this short one in the house to split kindling and small pieces of wood to start my fires, I used to go through at least one hatchet a year, handles just wouldn't hold up, handle breaks, heads fly off. I will redo this review if I destroy this one but from what I have seen so far looks like its going to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Great axe. Easy to wield
customer_reviews.text: Great axe. Easy to wield, and perfect size for splitting smaller logs or pre-split logs down smaller. Excellent for kindling! Needed sharpening on arrival, but is holding edge well ever since. Packs away into small spaces. Good feel and handle material is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mind Floss

customer_reviews.title: holding this thing like Floki does on that Vikings show
customer_reviews.text: I walk back from the woods, worn out, holding this thing like Floki does on that Vikings show... I was victorious Seriously though, it's got a nice balance, and is the perfect buddy for an axe. I got through a 10 inch green poplar with this guy, while it was sharp. Three hours of wacking, it's getting dull... time for the stone!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cross

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's not as heavy as it sounds.. I was considering getting the 14 in. Glad I went with the 17. I would gladly take this hiking all day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy splitting axe
customer_reviews.text: This is a relatively small axe for the splitting power. Split all wood, wet or dry, with one strike. This is a great tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well as a splitting axe would like to have a longer handle around 24 inches
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a splitting axe would like to have a longer handle around 24 inches. Was sharp enough to use right out of the box, which is unusual.I have the x27 with a 36 inch handle for the big rounds and it is light & effective.These represent great value, just need a mid size splitter in the line up.Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: NancyLynn

customer_reviews.title: Ax
customer_reviews.text: It would of been a really nice ax, but it didn't have a splitting edge, it was dulI already used it so I will not return this time
customer_reviews.author: Antonia Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.text: It is heaver than I thought it would be, but it Is a splitting axe, not a hatchet. Still, the weight makes it harder to control then a lighter regular hatchet which is a concern for me. Out at night in the snow, give me something that I know won't bite me when I'm not fully attentive. But it is beautiful to see and hold.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Busting down firewood and small brush from campsite
customer_reviews.text: Dad loves it for busting down firewood on camping trips
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little axe!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast of an axe for its size! This is my go to camping axe, easy to pack and splits small logs with ease.
customer_reviews.author: George R Freer II

customer_reviews.title: REALLY NICE MID SIZE AXE
customer_reviews.text: Wow, Sturdy and effective. Feels good in your hands. This is not the longest handled axe they have but great for my purposes. You can feel the quality. Definitely recommend. Does come with protective cover. Great Axe!!
customer_reviews.author: Ranchcop

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, Smooth, Well Balanced
customer_reviews.text: The blade is very sharp, and the gray coating definitely helps it to slide through the wood. After having split about a quarter of a cord of wood the coating is starting to wear off the edge of the blade (that would probably happen anyway the first time the blade is resharpened), but seems to be holding up elsewhere. The balance feels good, and it is very satisfying to have a well placed strike go right through a round of wood from end to end. I would definitely recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great handy axe.
customer_reviews.text: Great axe to keep near our outdoor fireplace for cutting and splitting. Works great. Stays sharp. Has a nice weight and swings easily.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Very nice axe but very hokey sheath. You'll what something better to protect and store the axe head.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E.

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars does it again :)
customer_reviews.text: Great combination of splitting and cutting. My new favorite kindling hatchet. You can also split woods like alder, clear fir.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: not good for doing both
customer_reviews.text: a little heavy for most hatchet work, a little too small to actually split firewood, buy an axe if you want to split. buy a hatchet for making kindling. not good for doing both. but sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua_smith524

customer_reviews.title: Great balance. Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: It slices, it dices, it chops. It's an axe... Great balance. Very sharp. Light weight. This coming fall I plan on getting the larger version to split rounds. This little guy is just for chopping up split wood into smaller pieces and making kindling. Which I knew when I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: This axe is for splitting small logs and boards for kindling. The construction is designed for splitting and not chopping. The length and weight is excellent. If you try and split with a hatchet that is not designed for splitting, the splinters will lodge in the head and eventually ruin the head construction. The balance is excellent and the axe comes sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wright

customer_reviews.title: nice splitting axe
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good Splitting axe, I thought it was a hatchet when I ordered it but it still works great. I bought it to take camping and have used it twice so far. It come really sharp but the edge needs to be refined a little because I had tiny chips (probably from using it the wrong way), but I sharpens it up and the chips came right out. Very good so far we will see what happens later on.
customer_reviews.author: therealrc2

customer_reviews.title: New addition to my backpacking kit!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for backyard kindle splitting and light enough to take with you on a backpacking trip. Comes with a cheap-o plastic cover for the blade but it does the job. Ax splits small kindling logs with ease and the back side can be used for a wedge hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Pitstop

customer_reviews.title: It works CRAZY GOOD!!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, it doesn't get stuck and splits camp wood by the fire beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Kia of Axes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this axe and the Gerber Camp Axe II at the same time to compare. The Gerber axe is sexier, by far, but essentially the same thing. I would say it is like comparing a Kia and a Hyundai. The Hyundai is a nicer car, but under the Hyundai skin, it is the same as a Kia. The Fiskars axe will do just fine, and you save $15-20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: ssteussy

customer_reviews.title: Nice length too
customer_reviews.text: Chopping wood and it was excellent as to balance and sharpness
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great axe - wished it had a shorter handle
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight and splits smaller diameter rounds typically in one hit just like it's X27 36" big brother.Even though it handles well and a tolerable weight, I wished the handle was 3" shorter, for a little less wrist stress when splitting a lot of kindling.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE

customer_reviews.title: Great little axe
customer_reviews.text: You simply can’t beat the value on these! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camping axe
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good one, 17” is small and good for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little chopper
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little chopper used it for making larger logs into kinlin 1 hit is all you need perfect swing but you have to be careful not to swing all the way through it cuts like a hot knife in butter
customer_reviews.author: Bluejay

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a good job this splitter does!
customer_reviews.text: I recently lost my heavy headed short splitter and wasn't sure how this splitter would perform as it did not have as large a head. Was I surprised! It did the job fantastically. It was better than the one I lost with clean splits on each swing. Highly recommend for breaking down chunks for kindling. Little effort with large results.
customer_reviews.author: Dofand

customer_reviews.title: Husband seems to really like it
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband. He uses it when camping to split logs into smaller pieces, usually. He seems to really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Very handy size for splitting kindling, just a bit bigger than a hatchet. Amazingly sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: fiskars axes
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. I use the x11 like a large hatchet, but you can also take one armed swings and split medium size wood like a splitting axe. I call it my combo axe. I also have fiskars x27 36" and the x25 28". They are excellent also. However the x25 28" must be used with care, because if you miss swing, the axe can hit you in the ankle, as I did. The x27 and x11 are all you need, they are my favorate picks. the teflon coating is good and when it wears off just spray a little oil and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: supersplitterman

customer_reviews.title: Little long
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Large hatchet. A little long for indoor chopping or small kindling but awesome for light duty splitting and chopping. Careful where you chop though, the blade is a softer metal and will dent/ding fairly easily. I like the plastic blade cover... Easy hang and easy to sharpen as well.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Double

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for Camping
customer_reviews.text: This axe is amazing for camping or just splittin/shopping small pieces of wood around the house. Despite being made for splitting, which is does extremely well, this axe is also sharp enough for chopping as well. I''ve taken this camping multiple times and provided you're not backpacking for weeks and a little extra weight is ok, this is the perfect little axe to bring. To be honest any of the Fiskars axes are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: JT24

customer_reviews.title: Handle and balance feel great, but with the included cover for the blade ...
customer_reviews.text: Handle and balance feel great, but with the included cover for the blade it would have been nice to ship it sharpened.
customer_reviews.author: C. Capeland

customer_reviews.title: Just for splitting
customer_reviews.text: Great small splitting axe-----this is NOT a chopping axe used to cut trees down
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great little axe. Seems to chop and split very well. Could be a little sharper, but that's no big deal. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: zachary

customer_reviews.title: ... to pay for a custom made this is the best available
customer_reviews.text: Unless u want to pay for a custom made this is the best available
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Kevin Garrison

customer_reviews.title: i now have an axe to grind!
customer_reviews.text: well made, quality axe. splits wood like nobody's business. the blade on the one i received was sharp enough to cut wood. i haven't had to sharpen it yet.
customer_reviews.author: nesnakes

customer_reviews.title: Really sharp and precise. - making kindling is easy!
customer_reviews.text: I never could split a log for kindling before. My husband's big ax was too heavy for me to use with much precision. This axe is so small and sharp that I have no problem splitting a log and can finally start the fires myself.
customer_reviews.author: Alison S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy a big heavy cumbersome axe.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best splitting axe available anywhere! This is second one of this model I have purchased, not because the old one wore out, but because I love it and I put the other one in my RV. I can split 12" dia. logs with this axe one handed for hours! It slices through oak and ash like butter and is very light and therefore very accurate! Takes no time at all to knock out a bundle of kindling!
customer_reviews.author: TL474

customer_reviews.title: This is a great handy little axe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great handy little axe. I haven't used it very heavily yet, but it is very sharp and handles kindling well.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Packs easily (I carry mine externally on my backpack)
customer_reviews.text: Well-balanced. Lightweight yet big enough to handle all but the largest chopping chores. Packs easily (I carry mine externally on my backpack). Stays sharp and re-sharpens easily. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John Oswald Jr

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced and SHARP!!!
customer_reviews.text: I split only 14 logs to start, but each was a "single hit" split. It probably would have been even easier if I had bought the one size larger. But this is large enough for splitting and small enough to handle like a hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight axe.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the low price. Lightweight and ready to handle. Very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Hatchet / axe
customer_reviews.text: Came really really sharp. Super tough, love it. Split some small wood with zero effort
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: X11
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS AXE, this is a perfect one handed splitting axe. It splits small to medium pieces like butter, and if I used both hands would probable work on larger pieces, but I have my 36in Fiskars x27 for those.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing how well this works to split wood, even rounds up to 18"
customer_reviews.author: Just some guy

customer_reviews.title: Just buy one.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the best axe on the market. Would rather carry one of these than an expensive Swedish alternative. Great tool that out-performs or matches axes that cost several hundred dollars.
customer_reviews.author: R-burg

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Handy small axe for trimming small branches, and splitting up kindling.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best splitting hatchet money can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Stapelkamp

customer_reviews.title: Nice Axe
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a replacement axe for kindling for a while. This is the perfect axe and size for the job. The handle is a little slippery, If I could knock off a half start for that I would. Not worth knocking a whole star off though.
customer_reviews.author: JimmC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so much I bought the x27,x15 and the splitting maul.
customer_reviews.author: earnest

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely amazing, I'll never use a cheap Coleman hatchet again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: Coated Blade Slides Through Wood
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about how well this weird looking axe would work, but it's amazing! It seems to pop right through firewood with little resistance. This 17" size is perfect for splitting campfire firewood.
customer_reviews.author: Gyropilot

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well balanced axe
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well balanced axe in 17 inch size. At the right price, this is a no-brainer purchase. It comes with a neat hard plastic sheath which locks around the axe head and has a carrying handle.
customer_reviews.author: JMDog

customer_reviews.title: Great axe!
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars products are very high quality, and this axe is no exception. We also have the 23" axe, and both axes have great weight balance. They are very sharp, and very well made. We'll buy more! Shipped fast also.
customer_reviews.author: Savanna S.

customer_reviews.title: The best ax I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I got this last spring for a season of camping. I mainly need an ax for splitting firewood, and that is exactly what this is designed for. It served me well all year. Lots of times it took one strike with this when it would have taken many with my old (Sears) ax.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kallio

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Took this camping with me and works great! Cuts easy. Has a plastic sheath for storage. What else can I say it works well!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A Very Nice Axe!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little axe. I have used it and abused it and it keeps working perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: William Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: All purpose hatchet
customer_reviews.text: The hatchet is a good size and will be easy to use. It will do the work I got it for. It is molded metal that won't come apart in use.
customer_reviews.author: idacalartist

product_meta.title: Fiskars X11 Splitting Axe, 17-Inch
product_meta.description:
Perfect as a secondary axe for quick jobs, the X11 is designed for easy one-handed use when splitting small logs. Like every X-Series Hatchet or Axe, the X11 combines perfected weight distribution, advanced blade geometry, an ultra-sharp edge and virtually unbreakable design to maximize your performance. This combination of features allows the blade to disperse wood more effectively, offering more one-strike splits with each swing. Since you can split wood more easily with the X11, each job requires less time, less effort and less hand strain.

AMAZON.COM


MAKE EVERY SWING YOUR BEST WITH AN AXE DESIGNED FOR EXTREME PERFORMANCE.
Unlike traditional axes that can be heavy, quick to dull and easy to break, X-Series axes combine perfected weight distribution, advanced blade geometry, an ultra-sharp edge and virtually unbreakable design to maximize your performance.

View larger. 

Note: Image shown is of the Fiskars X25 Splitting Axe. Proudly made in Finland, the axes are designed to be simple, functional and effective, helping you get more work done in less time. This design earned the X-Series axes the international red dot "best of the best" product design award for the garden category in 2010, recognizing outstanding design quality and trendsetters. A wide range of sizes and styles makes it easy to find the X-Series axe perfect for you, whether you're chopping kindling, chopping logs, splitting logs or felling trees.

THE X-SERIES ADVANTAGE
View larger. X-Series axes combine innovative features for chopping axes that chop 3X deeper and splitting axes that offer more one-strike splits.

View larger. MORE POWER AT IMPACT
All X-Series axes feature a smart design that distributes the majority of the weight to the axe head while keeping the stronger-than-steel FiberComp handle lightweight. This perfected weight distribution provides an optimal power-to-weight ratio that increases swing speed to multiply power, much like an aluminum baseball bat. X-Series axes give you more power at impact to help you get more done with every swing.

View larger. SUPERIOR BLADE DESIGN
The blades of X-Series axes are crafted with a proprietary grinding technique that provides a sharper edge for better contact and cleaner cuts. The hardened, forged steel blades also stay sharp longer than traditional axes, and a low-friction blade coating helps power through the tough logs and prevents the axe head from getting stuck. X-Series Splitting Axes also include advanced bevel convex blade geometry that adds even more power and disperses wood from the blade for cleaner, one-strike splits.

VIRTUALLY UNBREAKABLE
X-Series axes don't just outlast other axes--they're virtually impossible to break. A shock-absorbing FiberComp handle is lightweight yet stronger than steel, so it can't be broken through overstrike. The hardened, forged steel blade won't chip or crack, and the innovative PermaHead design is over-molded so the blade can't be separated from the handle.

 Note: Images shown are of the Fiskars X25 or X27 Splitting Axe.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This superbly designed, compact axe defies the concept of ¿size matters¿. Fact is, a smaller axe has its place in the world. Canoe trips into the Northwest Territories when space is tight. Trail clearing when you want to travel fast and light. And in the hands of smaller-framed people tired of being bossed around by an overgrown axe. If any of the situations above describe you, this is your axe. Plus, it¿s crafted with all the fine details of its bigger counterparts, including a unique wedge-shaped blade that takes fewer swings to bust through the toughest timber. The FiberComp fiberglass composite handle is many times stronger than traditional wood handles, yet it¿s also light in weight and impervious to weather. Fiskars¿ insert molded design prevents the head from ever loosening or separating from the handle. And a lifetime guarantee means you can trust to really hack it.

See more
feature_bullets: Ideal for easy one-handed use when splitting small logs
Designed for maximum efficiency to give you more one-strike splits
Perfected balance and power-to-weight ratio increases swing speed to multiply power, much like an aluminum baseball bat
Included sheath helps protect blade and the user
